Talking About His Struggling Phase, Shah Rukh Khan Says He Was Called 'Ugly' By A Director
Talking About His Struggling Phase, Shah Rukh Khan Says He Was Called 'Ugly' By A Director
There are no free lunches in life and everyone has to battle some amount of struggles before achieving success. If we talk about superstar Shah Rukh Khan, one of Bollywood's most bankable and popular actors, his journey into stardom didn't happen overnight.
Without a 'jugaad' in the industry, Shah Rukh Khan began his journey into the world of Cinema with baby steps that included theater and TV shows.
Agencies
He got his first break in Bollywood with Deewane in 1992 and rest, as they say, is history. He went on to achieve the tag of 'King Khan' and nothing much has changed even after three decades.
Pinterest
During a recent event in Lucknow, Khan took everyone down the memory lane as he spoke about his initial struggling days in Hindi Cinema. Talking about the days when the goal of becoming a superstar looked like a far-fetched dream, he said,

"I was practical and knew that I didn’t look the hero type, nor couldn’t I dance like one. In fact, a director once told me that he could use me anywhere because I was so ugly and not the hero-type."
He also revealed how he was in doubts about taking up a romantic film but it was Yash Chopra, who told him that if he wanted to be a legend he should be doing romantic films and that's how his journey began.
Khan is currently promoting his film Zero, that stars Anushka Sharma and Katrina Kaif in lead roles and will hit the theaters on December 21.
